channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: VW Camper has been left here for years and not moved, 6th August
item.description:

item.title: Untaxed, uninsured & Sorn, 6th August
item.description:
Vehicle is untaxed, uninsured and has been sorn for a number of years. It's been sat down the bottom of the close by the garages for years but has now been moved up to the top of the close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thwaite Close, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 6th August
item.description:
There is a grey Polo (registration plate BD56 LXS) right outside my house on 21 Lizban Street that has not moved for 6 months. I have a baby so the fact the car has not moved is becoming problematic for transporting my baby. The condition of the car is also gradually deteriorating having not been used for such a long time. I have done some research and it looks like the car failed its MOT on 8 January 2025 and then some work was done to the car to enable it to pass its MOT. There is a parcel in the footwell on the passenger side of the car addressed to the garage located on Reynolds Place (just around the corner from where the car is currently located). Without accusing anyone I strongly suspect the garage has not been paid for the work carried out and so they have dumped the car outside my house. I accept that Lizban Street is not a permit parking street so the car is not technically doing anything illegal. However I would be grateful if the council could look into getting the car moved/the matter discussed with the garage on Reynolds Place.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Lizban Street, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not resolved, 6th August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homer Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Smelly, blocked and leaking drain, 6th August
item.description:
This appears to be a recurring problem since June this year that has not been addressed. We are a trading restaurant where hygiene is very important as well as the saftely of customers and passers by. Smelly and dirty drains are not only unpleasant but are a health issue. Can this please be resolved as a matter of urgency. Please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, James Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
